thread.section_title: Logistics Report and News - Wall Street Journal
thread.title: Hershey Cuts Candy Varieties to Boost Profits

author: Annie Gasparro
title: Hershey Cuts Candy Varieties to Boost Profits
text:
Hershey Co. said it would stop selling certain sizes and varieties of candy to save money as costs rise.
The chocolatier said it has become too expensive and complex to manufacture, deliver and market its wide array of brands and special holiday varieties in the U.S. Hershey’s profit margin has been under pressure as a trucking shortage has driven up delivery costs, and cocoa prices have climbed.
